thread.section_title: News & Opinion: U.S. Politics | Boston Herald
thread.title: Pollster: Biden must make up his mind ‘this weekend’
thread.title_full: Pollster: Biden must make up his mind ‘this weekend’ | Boston Herald

author: Brian Dowling , Joe Dwinell
title: Pollster: Biden must make up his mind ‘this weekend’
text:
Vice President Joe Biden needs to stop flirting with his presidential ambitions by this weekend, a pollster told the Herald amid fresh reports the Democrat is close to a decision on a run for the White House.
Biden “has to make up his mind right away, and it has to be this weekend,” national pollster John Zogby said.
“I’m stunned he’s still considering getting in the race,” Zogby said. “I thought Hillary Clinton neutralized any hope Biden had.”
But her path to the White House is troubled, too, Zogby said, as Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders has raised nearly as much money as the former secretary of state and she has not put to bed the ongoing scandal with her use of a private email server.
“She brings in baggage, and doesn’t do well against all the Republican candidates,” Zogby said.
The vice president, though, polls well against the still-vast Republican field of candidates.
“At 72, he may be the fresh face in all of this,” he said.
Former Delaware Sen. Ted Kaufman, a Biden confidant, sent a letter to the vice president’s closest friends and advisers Thursday that says while the vice president is still undecided, a decision is close.
“If he runs, he will run because of his burning conviction that we need to fundamentally change the balance in our economy and the political structure to restore the ability of the middle class to get ahead,” Kaufman wrote.
“If he decides to run, we will need each and every one of you — yesterday.”
